org.transitime.core

Class VehicleAtStopInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.VehicleAtStopInfo

  • public class VehicleAtStopInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    So that VehicleState can keep track of whether vehicle is matched to a stop.
    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()

      • atEndOfBlock

        public boolean atEndOfBlock()
        Returns true if tripIndex, stopPathIndex, and segmentIndex are for the very last trip, path, segment for the block assignment. Had to override Indices.atEndOfBlock() because this class doesn't use the segment index while Indices does.
        Returns:

      • clone

        public org.transitime.core.Indices clone()
        Creates a copy of the Indices parameter. Useful if need to increment() or decrement() but don't want to affect the original object.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        indices - The object to clone
        Returns:

      • lessThan

        public boolean lessThan(org.transitime.core.Indices indices)
        Parameters:
        indices - what to compare to
        Returns:
        true if this indices indicate a match before that specified by the indices passed in

      • isEarlierStopPathThan

        public boolean isEarlierStopPathThan(org.transitime.core.Indices indices)
        Is this path earlier than the one passed in?
        Parameters:
        indices -
        Returns:

      • increment

        public org.transitime.core.Indices increment()
        Increments the indices to the next segment. If reached end of path then will increment the path index. And if reach end of trip then will increment the trip index.
        Returns:
        The resulting Indices object

      • incrementStopPath

        public org.transitime.core.Indices incrementStopPath()
        Increments indices so it points to the next path. Also sets the segmentIndex to 0 since the returned Indices are to point to the beginning of the next StopPath.
        Returns:
        Indices for the next StopPath for the assignment

      • decrement

        public org.transitime.core.Indices decrement()
        Decrements the indices to the previous segment. If going past beginning of path then path index is decremented. And if go past beginning of trip then the trip index is decremented.
        Returns:
        The resulting Indices object

      • decrementStopPath

        public org.transitime.core.Indices decrementStopPath()
        Decrements indices so it points to the previous path. Updates the trip and path indices. Also, updates segmentIndex so that it points to last segment on the new path.
        Returns:

      • getPreviousStopPath

        public StopPath getPreviousStopPath(int count)
        Gets a previous path for the block assignment.
        Parameters:
        count -
        Returns:
        The previous path, null if at beginning of block

      • getPreviousStopPath

        public StopPath getPreviousStopPath()
        Gets the previous path for the block assignment.
        Returns:
        The previous path, null if at beginning of block

      • pastEndOfBlock

        public boolean pastEndOfBlock()
        Returns true if used increment() to go past end of block as indicated by the tripIndex being beyond its limit.
        Returns:

      • beforeBeginningOfBlock

        public boolean beforeBeginningOfBlock()
        Returns true if used decrement() to go past beginning of block as indicated by the tripIndex being negative.
        Returns:

      • atBeginningOfTrip

        public boolean atBeginningOfTrip()
        Returns true if at beginning of trip. Useful for determining if calling increment() caused Indices to end one trip and start the next one.
        Returns:

      • atEndOfTrip

        public boolean atEndOfTrip()
        Returns true if at last path/stop for a trip. Does not look at the segmentIndex, only the stopPathIndex.
        Returns:

      • atEndOfStopPath

        public boolean atEndOfStopPath()
        Returns:
        true if at end of path indicating that at a stop and need to include the stop time as part of travel time

      • isLayover

        public boolean isLayover()
        Determines if indices indicate that at a layover. At a layover if on the last segment of the path for a stop that has a layover.
        Returns:
        true if path is for a layover where need to include layover time as part of travel time

      • isWaitStop

        public boolean isWaitStop()
        Indicates that vehicle is not supposed to depart the stop until the scheduled departure time.
        Returns:
        true if a wait stop

      • getScheduleTime

        public ScheduleTime getScheduleTime()
        Returns the schedule time for the trip and path indices specified
        Parameters:
        tripIndex -
        stopPathIndex -
        Returns:
        the schedule time for the specified stop. Returns null if no schedule time associated with stop

      • getStopTimeForPath

        public int getStopTimeForPath()
        Returns the time in msec for how long expected to be at the stop at the end of the path.
        Returns:

      • getTravelTimeForPath

        public int getTravelTimeForPath()
        Returns the travel time for the specified path. Does not include stop times.
        Returns:
